rev.comment: unnecessary fair use. This violates fair use protocol
rev.diff:
Line 324: Line 324:
Because of the public uproar over the [[U-2 Incident of 1960|U-2 Incident]], most of the official celebrations for the USS ''Triton''<nowiki>'</nowiki>s submerged circumnavigation were canceled. The voyage did receive extensive contemporary coverage by the news media, including feature magazine articles by [[Argosy (magazine)|''Argosy'']], [[Life (magazine)|''Life'']], [[Look (American magazine)|''Look'']], and [[National Geographic Magazine|''National Geographic'']], as well as television and newsreels.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,827597,00.html |title="12,005 Leagues Under The Sea" |accessdate=2008-09-13 |work= |publisher=[[Time (magazine)|''Time'']] |date=23 May 1960 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Sl_9FcYg5vg |title="New Magellan: Triton Circles World Submerged" |accessdate=2008-09-03 |work= |publisher=[[Universal Newsreel]] narrated by [[Ed Herlihy]] |date=1960-05-12}}</ref> ''Triton's'' submerged circumnavigation was the subject of the [[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]] television series ''Expedition!'' broadcast on Tuesday, 14 February 1960, [[1960-61 United States network television schedule|1961]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,826902,00.html |title=TV Listings |accessdate=2008-09-03 |work= |publisher=[[Time (magazine)|''Time'']] |date=[[Time (magazine)|''Time'']] }}</ref>
Because of the public uproar over the [[U-2 Incident of 1960|U-2 Incident]], most of the official celebrations for the USS ''Triton''<nowiki>'</nowiki>s submerged circumnavigation were canceled. The voyage did receive extensive contemporary coverage by the news media, including feature magazine articles by [[Argosy (magazine)|''Argosy'']], [[Life (magazine)|''Life'']], [[Look (American magazine)|''Look'']], and [[National Geographic Magazine|''National Geographic'']], as well as television and newsreels.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,827597,00.html |title="12,005 Leagues Under The Sea" |accessdate=2008-09-13 |work= |publisher=[[Time (magazine)|''Time'']] |date=23 May 1960 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Sl_9FcYg5vg |title="New Magellan: Triton Circles World Submerged" |accessdate=2008-09-03 |work= |publisher=[[Universal Newsreel]] narrated by [[Ed Herlihy]] |date=1960-05-12}}</ref> ''Triton's'' submerged circumnavigation was the subject of the [[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]] television series ''Expedition!'' broadcast on Tuesday, 14 February 1960, [[1960-61 United States network television schedule|1961]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,826902,00.html |title=TV Listings |accessdate=2008-09-03 |work= |publisher=[[Time (magazine)|''Time'']] |date=[[Time (magazine)|''Time'']] }}</ref>
â
The American government published an 82-page redacted version of the USS ''Triton's'' log following the submerged circumnavigation (see image below).<ref>First Submerged Circumnavigation 1960</ref> Captain Edward L. Beach wrote the lead article ("''Triton'' Follows Magellan's Wake") on the ''Triton'''s circumnavigation for the November 1960 issue of [[National Geographic Magazine|''National Geographic Magazine'']], and he also wrote a book-length account of the ''Triton's'' submerged circumnavigation published in 1962 (see image below of paperback version).<ref>Beach. ''Around the World Submerged''</ref>
+
The American government published an 82-page redacted version of the USS ''Triton's'' log following the submerged circumnavigation (see image below).<ref>First Submerged Circumnavigation 1960</ref> Captain Edward L. Beach wrote the lead article ("''Triton'' Follows Magellan's Wake") on the ''Triton'''s circumnavigation for the November 1960 issue of [[National Geographic Magazine|''National Geographic Magazine'']], and he also wrote a book-length account of the ''Triton's'' submerged circumnavigation published in 1962.<ref>Beach. ''Around the World Submerged''</ref>
====Official recognition====
====Official recognition====
